Description: Deep handmade bowl in fine Nile silt clay: with convex sides and a plain rim. The interior is deoxidised black and polished and the exterior is decorated with red painted lines and spots. Restored from fragments with a large part of one side missing.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 14.
